sn1.39:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
sn1.39:4.3: Then, late at night, the beautiful Kokanadā, Pajjunna’s daughter, lighting up the entire Great Wood, went up to the Buddha,
sn1.39:4.5: and recited these verses in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.39:5.2: is the Buddha, best of beings.
sn1.39:5.3: Kokanadā am I who worship him,
sn1.39:6.1: Previously I had only heard that
sn1.39:6.2: a seer had woken up to the truth.
sn1.39:6.3: But now I know it as a witness
sn1.39:6.4: while the sage, the Holy One teaches.
sn1.39:7.1: There are unintelligent people who go about
sn1.39:7.3: They fall into the terrible Hell of Screams
sn1.39:8.1: There are those who have found acceptance and peace
sn1.39:8.3: After giving up this human body,
sn1.39:8.4: they swell the hosts of gods.”
